Jeff McGlothin

Current Term:  November 2024 - November 2027
Email Jeff McGlothin: jmcglothin@cibolotx.gov

Jeff McGlothin was born in Milwaukie, Oregon, where he graduated from high school. He went on to pursue higher education at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, before transferring to American Continental University. He holds degrees in Intelligence Technologies and Criminal Justice.

In 2008, Jeff enlisted in the Oregon Air National Guard as an intelligence analyst. During his military service, he deployed to the Middle East as a Tactical Systems Officer as part of a Joint Task Force. In his civilian career, Jeff served as a contract manager for the Department of Homeland Security, overseeing physical security operations for federal facilities across the Pacific Northwest.

In 2018, Jeff was commissioned as an Intelligence Officer and transferred to the Air Force Reserve. The following year, he and his family moved to Cibolo, Texas, where he quickly became involved in the community. In 2023, Jeff was appointed to Cibolos Zoning Board of Adjustments, where he served for one year before being elected to City Council.

Jeff is a strong advocate for small, homegrown businesses and is committed to preserving Cibolos small-town charm while supporting its continued growth and development.
